This game is amazing. Tons of players, tons of dungeons, and tons to do. I have played this game for 5 years, and it's by far my favorite game.   While this is an awesome game, there are a few things that I don't like:  * It's not very new-player friendly. You're given one character slot, and one vault. This almost forces you to spend money to play the game, as having only one character and vault makes the game almost impossible to play.  * While there are a lot of items, there isn't much diversity in the different sets of gear you have. You can't have one set of gear on your Knight that is specifically used for one thing, and have another set of items for another task. Adding more items that bring diversity to classes would be amazing.  * The classes. While there are quite a few classes, someone like me who has played for awhile gets bored of the classes. A lot of the classes are very similar to other classes, making the choices for different play styles even smaller.   * Dungeons. We need harder dungeons that require more multiplayer. The Shatters dungeon was a great start, and the Epic dungeons are amazing. Maybe doing something like Legendary dungeons would make the game more interesting. I personally would love to see an upgraded version of the Haunted Cemetery.  * Guilds. Guilds are pretty useless. They do nothing, and have no purpose. The only thing I use the guild hall for is opening dungeons for my guild mates, which could easily be done either in a Bazaar, or in a dungeon in a realm. I love the idea of Guild realms, but I know that would be a strain on the servers, and cause the game to be very laggy.   * Community. My last complaint. Most of the players of this game are toxic, and do nothing but talk trash and drag enemies to try and kill you. I'm pretty sure this is a thing already, but if you have proof of someone dragging, that player should be banned. Temp muting should also be introduced and be executed by in-game moderators/staff for those who harass others.

If you can't stand grinding in games, definitely not the game for you. If you can, give it a try.  -----------------  RotMG (As we call it) is a MMO bullet hell style game, where you enter the realm in search for good loot, unique dungeons and take on the Mad God himself at his castle. However, if you die, you loose that character and its loot for good! Play with your friends, join a guild and aim for the top! The goal is to get the best gear you can, drink stat potions that increase attack, defence, health, mana, and other things! The community is very nice on the most part, whilst some people will intentionally try to get you killed. RotMG has recently been given a chance to live as DECA Games has taken ownership from Kabam, who had made the community very unhappy, trying to get as much money as possible. If you do stick around, you will make new friends, and will enjoy it, get mad at it, but have lots of fun!  -----------------  You can play it on a browser as well as steam, which is why I have so little play time, as the steam version has had some issues in the past.

(You do not have to read this but if you choose to I would like to say why I don't have a lot of hours played my steam wont work on my computer anymore so im using flash player. And to write this article im using steams web site.)Hello! Deca Games. This is going to be my review on Realm of the Mad God. Before I start with anything I would like to say my ign is Davicee, that being said lets start with the review. The first thing I would like to say is how I like the bullet hell style. It makes it so you have to deal a lot of damage while also watching your back because if not you might die. I also like the chance of getting a drop in dungeons, If im doing an abyss and I get a lot of damage in I'm not guaranteed drop although what I do wish is that you guys add loot drops for everyone. Because not all new plays are going to be able to get damage in and if there in a dungeon with much stronger people then the odds of them getting anything is off the charts. Last thing I would like to address is how the perma death works. I like the fact that when you die you lose your character, sure it sucks when you lose everything but that's the point of the game. Its like a constant wager with you against the enemy so if you mess up then you can die and lose all your stuff. Imagine realm without perma death. You would get so much loot and not lose it if you die so there wouldn't even be a point in playing the game.  To end it off here I will like to say how realm is a great game and I think it is even better now that you guys (deca games) has taken over. That being said hope you enjoy my review on realm of the mad god. I would give this game a 8.5-9/10

No game has brought me more polar emotions than this- hair ripping anger and addictive ecstatic excitement. Strutting around with that new special item is great but the despairing/frustrated feeling of a character dying or meeting a cancerous tumour in game is just as strong.  I recommend spending a few bucks on buying one or two more character slots and a couple of vaults- don't treat it as F2P. The money you spend on it will allow you to maximise enjoyment without spending hours grinding and despairing over Kabam's $$$ grabbing schemes.  The community is not the greatest- this game is basically USA-capitalist simulator- but there are still those that play for fun. If you find a group of buddies to play with (voice chat of some sort is nice) or don't mind ignoring everyone then it's a solid game. Worth playing but not worth the time spent on it (VERY ADDICTIVE).

Realm of the Mad God is a good game. But like any other game it has it's pros and cons but in this review I'll be more specifically talking about the cons.  Cons -Got rid of buying items with fame -Enemies get repetitve -Game needs some new dungeons or enemies to make the game less repetitive -Vault and Character slots cost are to expensive not everybody has the money to buy coins to get vault space and character slots especially for the people who play this game a lot but only have 2 or 3 character slots and only 2 chest open in the vault. -The Dev's need to start cracking down on Multiboxers and hackers because I see them everywhere -You need to make it to where you can loot graves again!  That's really all that I have in negatives about this game other than that this is a pretty good game.

PERMA DEATH. There, thats out the way. Start this retro 8 bit game by making a starter character. Rogue, archer, knight, wizard, priest, and warrior. Each one like RPG goodness has there own special ability and weapon/gear set. Witch is or only makes up 4 peices. 4, thats it. No crazy rings and bling everywhere or multiple weapons. With your simple 8 bit, 4 geard and one special ability character go out and venture forth into the realm of the mad god. Oryx. Defeat pirates and pixies and hobbits, dwarfs and crazy what not creatures and dragons to get from lv 1 to 20. There are health and mana potions, and teirs of the 4 gear equipment. GIT GUD. Travel around the realm only to survive and make your character better in this bullet hell dodging game. Lag kills. Distraction kills. Pick up gold and gain fame with your character to gain better tier gear or unlock more characters like the ninja or paliden to use. Pets are also available now to help you out to in this realm...of the mad god. Kill gods to gain awesome pots stat boosts and go through dungeons to defeat unique bosses. Telaportion is available to other characters to help keep strength in numbers and a main nexus is needed to escape and take breaks from getting red eyes and carpel tunnel. If you're a lover of bullethells, dungeondrawlers, and rage-inducing games, look no further! Realm of the Mad God is a pixelated two dimensional game in which you fight your way to become extremely powerful. Choose from a number of classes from archer to sorcerer and more! Be warned though, you might rage a bit when your character dies. Upon death in this game, your character deletes itself pretty much, and you have to start from scratch. For those who don't mind grinding and love a challenge, this game is perfect.
It's super adicting, you just need to not rage too much. The lag and pay to wing are annoying, but with enough patience and an almost infinite amount of time you can still do everything.
